oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Parole of Cpl. W. J. Morris of Morton's Artillery, Forrest's Corps CSA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Parole issued to Cpl. Morris at Gainesville, Ala., where most of Gen. N. B. Forrest's troopers were paroled. At the time Cpl. Morris was residing in Fort Hindman, Ky. The parole permits him "to return to his home, not to be disturbed by the United States authorities, so long as he observes his parole and the laws in force where he may reside." Signed by Union Maj. Gen. E. R. I. Canby.
